Description: Stamp (vessel): quarter-qisṭ. Measure of olive-oil. Five line Kufic inscription. Small chip off top left. Made of green glass.
Curator's comments: See OA+ 4045, OA+ 4046 and 1894,0309.9. From the same die: Launois, Aimée. 1957. Estampilles et poids faibles en verre Omeyyades et Abbasides au Musée Arabe du Caire, ‘Mélanges islamologiques’ III, 116; Miles, G.C. 1958. ‘Contributions to Arabic metrology’ I. New York, 71-2; Miles, G.C. 1963. ‘Contributions to Arabic metrology’ II (I. Benaki Museum). New York, 20; Balog 1976, 227-8, Cf. Miles, G.C. 1951. ‘Early Arabic Weights and Stamps: a supplement’. New York, 14; Launois 1957, 117-8; Miles 1958, 73; Balog, P. 1976. ‘Ummayad, ʿAbbasid and Ṭūlūnid glass weights and vessel-stamps’. New York, 229-32.
Yazīd b. Abī Yazīd issued quarter-qisṭ, half-qisṭ and qisṭ measures for olive oil. The legends all begin ‘amara’ and all illustrated specimens of each denomination are from one die.
Bibliographic references: Morton 1985 / A Catalogue of Early Islamic Glass Stamps (120)
Associated names: Named in inscription: Yazīd b. Abī Yazīd
